meanings.definition: The action or process of marking with lines.
meanings.sent1: The artist's lineation of the landscape added depth to the painting.
meanings.sent2: The lineation on the map helped us navigate through the city.
meanings.sent3: The lineation of the cake with frosting made it look like a colorful map.
meanings.sent4: Her lineation of thoughts on paper was as clear as a blueprint.
meanings.sent5: The lineation of the dance steps made the routine easy to follow.

meanings.sent1: The lineation of books on the shelf was neat and organized.
meanings.sent2: The lineation of the bricks in the wall created a striking design.
meanings.sent3: The lineation of ducks in a row made them look like a parade.
meanings.sent4: The lineation of stars in the sky formed a beautiful constellation.
meanings.sent5: The lineation of trees along the path provided a sense of direction.

meanings.definition: The quality of having distinct lines or linear features.
meanings.sent1: The lineation of the fabric made it easy to cut straight lines.
meanings.sent2: The lineation of the building's architecture gave it a modern look.
meanings.sent3: The lineation of the clouds resembled a giant fluffy caterpillar.
meanings.sent4: The lineation of the mountain range was like a jagged silhouette against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The lineation of the pattern on the wallpaper added a touch of elegance to the room.
